content:
• Monday, November 21, 2011
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar (NYSE:JKS) is trading down after hours following Q3 report that beat revenue...

    JinkoSolar (NYSE:JKS) is trading down after hours following Q3 report that beat revenue estimates but disappoined on a Y/Y basis. Earnings fell 74% as the Chinese solar-product maker saw higher prices weigh on its margins. The company guides Q4 revenue below estimates, now saying it expects to earn between $180M - $210M, below Street expectations for $244M. Shares -14.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • OIIM

    O2Micro (NASDAQ:OIIM) is awarded 13 patents for its Battery Cell Monitor and Balance IC. The...

    O2Micro (NASDAQ:OIIM) is awarded 13 patents for its Battery Cell Monitor and Balance IC. The patent is a continuation of an existing one - issued to the company in April, 2010 - that monitors cells and balances voltage levels of cells in battery packs for notebook computers, cell phones, PDAs, and other devices with multi-cell rechargeable batteries. Despite the award, shares are trading -4.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is down 6% AH after declaring in an 8-K it's selling $200M of zero coupon...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is down 6% AH after declaring in an 8-K it's selling $200M of zero coupon convertible notes to VC firm TCV, at a conversion price of $85.80/share (60% less than what Netflix traded at 3 months ago). As part of the deal, TCV gains the right to nominate a candidate to Netflix's board. The deal is likely raising fears about Netflix's cash burn, given shrinking margins and rising content costs. (earlier) Update:Â Netflix will also be issuing $200M in stock to other parties as part of the deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 5 Comments
  • ZLC

    Zale (NYSE:ZLC): FQ1 EPS of -$0.99 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $350.9M (+7% Y/Y) beats by $12.3M....

    Zale (NYSE:ZLC): FQ1 EPS of -$0.99 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $350.9M (+7% Y/Y) beats by $12.3M. Same-store sales up 5.8% Y/Y, compared with 9.8% in FQ4 2011. Gross margin was 53.5%, up 220 bps Q/Q and 300 bps Y/Y. Shares +9.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • DCTH

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH) enters into an initial launch and training agreement for its Delcath...

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH) enters into an initial launch and training agreement for its Delcath Hepatic Chemstat Delivery system with the European Institute of Oncology, a European cancer treatment and research center located in Milan, Italy. Shares +12.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • DY

    Dycom (NYSE:DY): FQ1 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $319.6M (+17% Y/Y) beats by $27.9M....

    Dycom (NYSE:DY): FQ1 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $319.6M (+17% Y/Y) beats by $27.9M. Shares +8.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • HPQ

    More on H-P's FQ4: Revenue declined in Americas and EMEA, rose in Asia-Pac. Enterprise hardware...

    More on H-P's FQ4: Revenue declined in Americas and EMEA, rose in Asia-Pac. Enterprise hardware business saw 4% Y/Y revenue drop (7% gain in FQ3). Services grew 2% (4% in FQ3). PC revenue fell 2% (9% consumer drop), not as bad as some expected. Imaging & Printing fell 10% (just 1% in FQ3). Software was a bright spot, up 28% (boosted a little by Autonomy). HPQ +2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • HPQ

    Hewlett-Packard (NYSE:HPQ): FQ4 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $32.1B (-3% Y/Y) beats...

    Hewlett-Packard (NYSE:HPQ): FQ4 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $32.1B (-3% Y/Y) beats by $250M. Company expects FQ1 EPS of $0.83-$0.86, below $1.11 consensus. Expects FY12 EPS of "at least $4.00," compared with $4.56 consensus. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • EEFT

    Euronet Worldwide (EEFT -1.3%) dips today despite an upgrade by Piper Jaffray to Overweight on...

    Euronet Worldwide (EEFT -1.3%) dips today despite an upgrade by Piper Jaffray to Overweight on valuation, citing the strength of the company's growing ATM business.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • TIF

    Retailers take a hit after a Barron's article over the weekend suggests that holiday spending...

    Retailers take a hit after a Barron's article over the weekend suggests that holiday spending this year may be at the low end or below expectations. Retail shares have outperformed for most of this year, thanks in large part to strong consumer spending - at the expense of savings - but that trend soon is likely to end: Tiffany & Co. (TIF -4.4%), Nordstrom (JWN -1%), Coach (COH -1.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • GILD

    CNBC reports (video) an unusually high volume of call options in Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS +84.7%)...

    CNBC reports (video) an unusually high volume of call options in Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS +84.7%) were purchased just a few days before the buyout of the company by Gilead Sciences (GILD -9.7%). Analysts say the activity may get more than a passing glance look from regulators.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 4 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA +5.7%) shares have become the envy of the tech sector (for today, anyway) after...

    Nvidia (NVDA +5.7%) shares have become the envy of the tech sector (for today, anyway) after Longbow's JoAnne Feeney provides "independent confirmation" of SemiAccurate's report about Nvidia's graphics chips being designed into next-gen MacBooks, and estimates the win will produce $40M in 2012 revenue. Interestingly, AMD (AMD -0.4%), whom Nvidia displaced, is also outperforming.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Headed into the last 30 minutes of trade, stocks are attempting a comeback, still nicely off,...

    Headed into the last 30 minutes of trade, stocks are attempting a comeback, still nicely off, but about 1.4% above session lows. DJIA -1.8%, Nasdaq -1.5%. There's no evident catalyst, but one symbol of EU fears, Jefferies (JEF +2.2%) has reversed sharp early losses following a strong defense of its position.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • FMCN

    Thanks to both the selloff in risk assets, and Focus Media's (FMCN -45.6%) dive into Muddy...

    Thanks to both the selloff in risk assets, and Focus Media's (FMCN -45.6%) dive into Muddy Waters (I, II), several Chinese tech ADRs are among the day's worst performers. Among these names are former Muddy Waters target Spreadtrum (SPRD -11.5%), and recent Citron Research target Qihoo 360 (QIHU -9.9%). Also off sharply: SINA -11.1%. YOKU -12.5%. RENN -8.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • VNO

    Vornado Realty Trust (VNO -3.3%) trades lower after Goldman cuts the shares to Sell from Neutral...

    Vornado Realty Trust (VNO -3.3%) trades lower after Goldman cuts the shares to Sell from Neutral citing limited relative growth versus other names in its peer group.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • BPR

    General Growth Properties (GGP -2.7%) trades lower on a Goldman downgrade to Neutral, citing...

    General Growth Properties (GGP -2.7%) trades lower on a Goldman downgrade to Neutral, citing higher relative leverage and modest 2012 growth projections.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM (SIRI +6.2%) adds to today's gains off an earlier Lazard upgrade by announcing the...

    Sirius XM (SIRI +6.2%) adds to today's gains off an earlier Lazard upgrade by announcing the launch of two new diametrically different radio stations: "Muppet Radio" and "Ozzy's Boneyard" with Ozzy Osbourne.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • HAYN

    Haynes International (HAYN +2%) - already buoyed by an upgrade from JPMorgan - also catches a...

    Haynes International (HAYN +2%) - already buoyed by an upgrade from JPMorgan - also catches a price target increase from Auniga to $68 - repping 19% upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • FMCN

    The bloodletting in Focus Media (FMCN -54.8%) following a critical Muddy Waters report (.pdf)...

    The bloodletting in Focus Media (FMCN -54.8%) following a critical Muddy Waters report (.pdf) has reached extraordinary levels. In some ways, the move is an inverse of the run-ups tech stocks saw in the 1999-2000 bubble following a mention in the Gilder Technology Report. Muddy Waters is accusing Focus Media of overstating the size of its ad network, and of claiming to acquire companies it never actually purchased.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 3 Comments
  • HAYN

    Haynes International (HAYN +2%) moves up on a JP Morgan upgrade to Overweight. The firm notes...

    Haynes International (HAYN +2%) moves up on a JP Morgan upgrade to Overweight. The firm notes Haynes is a pure specialty alloy producer without stainless steel exposure, and should weather the recent macroeconomic uncertainty and nickel price volatility better than other metal producers.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • CLDX

    Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX +1.5%) gets a boost after announcing positive results in its Phase 2...

    Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX +1.5%) gets a boost after announcing positive results in its Phase 2 clinical trials for rindopepimut, a drug treatment for brain cancer patients with newly diagnosed glioblastoma.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD -6.3%) drops as the company's 180 day post-IPO lockup period comes to an end,...

    LinkedIn (LNKD -6.3%) drops as the company's 180 day post-IPO lockup period comes to an end, making about 24M shares of stock eligible to be sold. The biggest seller is Bain Capital, an early investor who plans to sell its entire stake of 3.7M shares at whatever the market will bear.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 5 Comments
  • PPC

    Shares of Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +3.3%) tack on a gain after rival Tyson (TSN -2%) says in its FQ4...

    Shares of Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +3.3%) tack on a gain after rival Tyson (TSN -2%) says in its FQ4 report that it sees "gradually improve market pricing conditions" in poultry and the broader meat market. Investors may also be latching on to Tyson's earnings miss as a competitive advantage for PPC with the firm trying to shake off ratings snubs from S&P and Moody's (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM (SIRI +5.6%), up on Friday thanks to a Lazard upgrade, is rising today on an NY Post...

    Sirius XM (SIRI +5.6%), up on Friday thanks to a Lazard upgrade, is rising today on an NY Post report claiming Liberty Media (LCAPA) is "having discussions" about adding to its 40% stake in the company, which it acquired in 2009. It's noted that "tax implications and other disadvantages" may prevent Liberty from upping its stake for now, but these issues go away in March.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • HIBB

    Hibbett (HIBB +1.6%) trades higher today on an upgrade to buy at Sterne Agee following Friday's...

    Hibbett (HIBB +1.6%) trades higher today on an upgrade to buy at Sterne Agee following Friday's FQ3 earnings report and a raised forecast. The firm notes strip center and mall locations were on par with one another for the first time in years.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • CRM

    Raymond James' Terry Tillman is upgrading Salesforce.com (CRM -3.2%) to Buy following Friday's...

    Raymond James' Terry Tillman is upgrading Salesforce.com (CRM -3.2%) to Buy following Friday's post-earnings drubbing. While many are concerned about the soft deferred revenue and billings figures found in Salesforce's FQ3 report, Tillman thinks investors should focus on the company's healthy FY12 revenue guidance, and its record number of large deal signings.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM | 4 Comments
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +0.9%) gains after the company receives a Notice of Allowance from the...

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +0.9%) gains after the company receives a Notice of Allowance from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office for an application directed to increasing the plasma half-life of therapeutic proteins and peptides by recombinantly conjugating them to a unique, non-immunogenic peptide repeat sequence.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • GLD

    Gold takes out new lows for the session, dropping to $1,675/oz. and not helping a bit in the...

    Gold takes out new lows for the session, dropping to $1,675/oz. and not helping a bit in the midst of a large equity sell-off. "When you really need something for safety, gold disappoints you," tweets one punter. "A safe haven loses its safety when it is not contentious," says hedge fund manager Hugh Hendry. GLD -2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 6 Comments
  • IFF

    International Flavors & Fragrances (IFF +0.2%) bucks a weak tape after JP Morgan ups the...

    International Flavors & Fragrances (IFF +0.2%) bucks a weak tape after JP Morgan ups the shares to Overweight, citing valuation, a solid balance sheet, and expectations for local currency growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • FMCN

    Shares of Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) shed 25% on trading volume over 4X normal activity after...

    Shares of Focus Media (NASDAQ:FMCN) shed 25% on trading volume over 4X normal activity after Muddy Waters issues negative coverage on the stock with a Strong Sell rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • RGLD

    Royal Gold (RGLD -4%) trades lower after RBC cut the shares to Sector Perform on relative...

    Royal Gold (RGLD -4%) trades lower after RBC cut the shares to Sector Perform on relative valuation and lowers its price target to $94 from $102.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • WBA

    Walgreens (WAG -4.3%) dips after Morgan Stanley cuts its rating on the shares to Underweight....

    Walgreens (WAG -4.3%) dips after Morgan Stanley cuts its rating on the shares to Underweight. Morgan says the company's likely exit from the Express Scripts retail network - and potentially Medco - could to lead significant earnings uncertainty going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNTF

    China Techfaith Wireless (NASDAQ:CNTF), a maker of low-end Android phones and tablets, is down...

    China Techfaith Wireless (NASDAQ:CNTF), a maker of low-end Android phones and tablets, is down 7.7% after reporting Q3 revenue of $80.6M (+17% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.06. Results were hurt by a 6% Q/Q decline in private label device sales, as competition between Chinese Android vendors heats up. Moreover, the company is guiding for revenue of just $78M-$81M in seasonally strong Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • FCX

    Freeport-McMoRan (FCX -2.8%) agrees to pay Chinese copper smelting giant Jiangxi Copper a 12.4%...

    Freeport-McMoRan (FCX -2.8%) agrees to pay Chinese copper smelting giant Jiangxi Copper a 12.4% higher rate to refine its copper next year, a sign global copper supply could see a boost in 2012. Moreover, it may mean that the company is nearing a solution to ongoing labor disputes at its Papua, New Guinea mine, where production has been curtailed due to labor strikes.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • PRSN

    Medical device maker BSD Medical (BSDM +11.2%) jumps after receiving FDA approval for the...

    Medical device maker BSD Medical (BSDM +11.2%) jumps after receiving FDA approval for the commercial sale of its heat-therapy system used in the treatment of cervical cancer patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +8.8%) pops on reports that it's in discussions with restructuring advisers, as...

    Clearwire (CLWR +8.8%) pops on reports that it's in discussions with restructuring advisers, as the money-losing wireless carrier wrestles with a large debt payment coming due December 1st.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM

  • Wild action in the currency markets where the euro is having none of this "risk off" action,...

    Wild action in the currency markets where the euro is having none of this "risk off" action, soaring in the past few minutes to $1.3521, unchanged for the day. The other "risk" currencies - the aussie, the loonie, the real, the peso ... all remain sharply lower. Something's up.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 5 Comments
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (GDOT -5.8%) trades down on a Piper Jaffray downgrade to Neutral, citing competitive...

    Green Dot (GDOT -5.8%) trades down on a Piper Jaffray downgrade to Neutral, citing competitive pressures and an underleveraged distribution network.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -6%) is making fresh 52-week lows after receiving a rash of negative...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -6%) is making fresh 52-week lows after receiving a rash of negative sell-side notes. JMP is downgrading RIM to Underperform, citing competition from low-end smartphones; RBC is cutting its PT after its checks indicated weak U.S. sales (nothing new); and Credit Suisse is slashing its estimates, predicting RIM's BBX devices won't arrive until mid-2012, and declaring a buyout unlikely. (Canaccord)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • CECO

    Career Education (CECO -5%) trades lower on reports its accreditor is seeking more information...

    Career Education (CECO -5%) trades lower on reports its accreditor is seeking more information from the for-profit educator, just weeks after an external investigation found 36 of company's schools failed to meet minimum accreditation standards for placement rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • INHX

    The huge runup in shares of Inhibitex (INHX +32%) following the announcement of the...

    The huge runup in shares of Inhibitex (INHX +32%) following the announcement of the Gilead-Pharmasset deal makes sense to Canaccord Genuity. Analysts with the firm say the premium paid by Gilead (GILD -11.3%) validates the nuc prodrug platform and will "provide a backbone" to the hepatitis C treatment landscape for both INHXÂ and GILD.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • REGN

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +9.7%) pops after the FDA approved Eylea, its drug treatment for...

    Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +9.7%) pops after the FDA approved Eylea, its drug treatment for a leading cause of blindness in the elderly, late last week. Separately, BofA Merrill Lynch upgrates the stock to Neutral on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • PRE

    Shares of PartnerRe (PRE +0.2%) tick higher after the firm announces a plan to repurchase up to...

    Shares of PartnerRe (PRE +0.2%) tick higher after the firm announces a plan to repurchase up to 7M shares. The potential buyback - repping ~10% of outstanding shares - will supersede a previously announced plan by the global reinsurance firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies (JEF -3%) sends an extraordinary letter to shareholders, blasting a hedge fund for...

    Jefferies (JEF -3%) sends an extraordinary letter to shareholders, blasting a hedge fund for "spreading false rumors." The company says it has reduced exposure to the PIIGS by nearly 75%, and is actually net short the group. Somebody has to be long, no? (PR, pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 17 Comments
  • TX

    Ternium (TX -4.8%) trades lower after Goldman cuts the shares to Neutral, citing the negative...

    Ternium (TX -4.8%) trades lower after Goldman cuts the shares to Neutral, citing the negative impact from the company's potential acquisition of Usiminas.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • AVNR

    Avanir Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVNR) falls off 6.4% after an SEC filing tips off insider...

    Avanir Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVNR) falls off 6.4% after an SEC filing tips off insider selling. Shares are now threatening their 52-week low.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • SVM

    Silvercorp (SVM -7%) dips after announcing it's acquiring China's SX Gold Mining - a company...

    Silvercorp (SVM -7%) dips after announcing it's acquiring China's SX Gold Mining - a company controlled by the city government of Luoyang in Henan Province - through through one of its Chinese subsidiaries for around $22.75M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • TSN

    Tyson Foods (TSN -2%) drops after reporting Q4 EPS of $0.26, vs. expectations of $0.32. Total...

    Tyson Foods (TSN -2%) drops after reporting Q4 EPS of $0.26, vs. expectations of $0.32. Total profit of $97M was 54% lower than a year ago even as revenue jumped 13% to $8.4B. A reduction in gross margins - from 9% to 4.7% - due to higher feed costs was the culprit. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • HOTT

    Shares of Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT) move 3.2% higher after the firm catches an upgrade from Piper...

    Shares of Hot Topic (NASDAQ:HOTT) move 3.2% higher after the firm catches an upgrade from Piper Jaffray to Overweight from Neutral. The stock is starting to become a favorite of analysts after landing a ringing endorsement from Roth and positive comments from Needham within the last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD -3.2%) says it will acquire Z Corp, a maker of 3D printers and scanners, and...

    3D Systems (DDD -3.2%) says it will acquire Z Corp, a maker of 3D printers and scanners, and Vidar, a maker of medical film scanners, for a combined $137M in cash, which it will obtain by issuing $152M in 5.5% convertible notes. Z Corp and Vidar generated a combined $58M in revenue in the 12 months ending June 30. 3D Systems shares are currently halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM

  • Following a 1% bounce from around the time NYC rolled out of bed, European shares return to...

    Following a 1% bounce from around the time NYC rolled out of bed, European shares return to their lows of the session as U.S. markets open. Stoxx 50 -2.7%. Italy is hardest hit, -3.6%, the U.K. performing best, -2%. The euro continues to hang in there, -0.5% at $1.3454.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • GEDU

    Premarket gainers: GEDU +96%. OTCPK:VRUS +86%. INHX +30%. CLDX +8%. CTIC +6%. CLWR +6%. DNDN...

    Premarket gainers: GEDU +96%. OTCPK:VRUS +86%. INHX +30%. CLDX +8%. CTIC +6%. CLWR +6%. DNDN +6%. CBE +5%.
    Losers: GERN -7%. KYG -6%. GILD -6%. RIO -5%. FRO -5%. RDN -4%. LNKD -4%. MT -4%. AIXG -3%. INVN -3%. GMCR -3%. CIM -3%. RIMM -3%. ANR -3%. BCS -3%. JEF -3%. AKS -3%. MPEL -3%. MU -3%. RMBS -3%. BHP -3%. DB -3%. TM -3%. NOK -3%. IHG -3%. BIDU -3%. PCX -3%. VALE -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • MET

    MetLife (NYSE:MET) announces the reorganization of its businesses from U.S./International to 3...

    MetLife (NYSE:MET) announces the reorganization of its businesses from U.S./International to 3 broad geographic regions - Americas, EMEAÂ (Europe, Middle East, Africa), and Asia - "to better reflect the company's global reach." The move follows last year's $16.4B purchase of Alico. Shares -1.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) gains 5.8% after stating the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services...

    Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) gains 5.8% after stating the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) updated its coverage policy to include infusion costs for Dendreon's Provenge prostate cancer drug. Moreover, the CMS will retroactively cover Provenge claims made since June 30. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 2 Comments
  • Y

    As expected, Alleghany (NYSE:Y) confirms it will buy reinsurer Transatlantic (TRH +4.7%) for...

    As expected, Alleghany (NYSE:Y) confirms it will buy reinsurer Transatlantic (TRH +4.7%) for $3.4B in cash and stock, or $59.79/share. That's a 10% premium on TRH's Friday close. The deal theoretically ends a long process involving a series of suitors for TRH, although it's already called off an M&A with Allied World. (previous) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • INHX

    Shares of Hepatitis C treatment providers Inhibitex (NASDAQ:INHX) and Vertex Pharmaceuticals...

    Shares of Hepatitis C treatment providers Inhibitex (NASDAQ:INHX) and Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) show upward momentum following the news of Gilead's (NASDAQ:GILD) blockbuster deal to buy Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS). Premarket: INHX +31%, VRTX +2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM

  • Commodities are lower, responding to the sell-off in equities and pop in the dollar. Busting...

    Commodities are lower, responding to the sell-off in equities and pop in the dollar. Busting through $103/barrel last week, WTI crude is back to $96.22. Gold falls below $1,700/oz. for the first time in a month, now -1.4% at $1,699.50. Copper -2.7% to $3.31/lb.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM

  • Moody's says rising French debt yields and weak growth prospects could be negative for France's...

    Moody's says rising French debt yields and weak growth prospects could be negative for France's credit rating, Le Figaro reports. Possibly in reaction, 10-year government yields +13 bps to 3.8%. (Reuters report)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 AM

  • European stocks open the week lower, weighed down by the failure of the Congressional...

    European stocks open the week lower, weighed down by the failure of the Congressional "supercommittee" to reach a debt deal and on eurozone worries, with the decisive election victory of Spain's Popular Party having little effect. Madrid -1%, Euro STOXX 50 -1.35%, London -1.2%, Paris -1.9%, Frankfurt -1.6%, Milan -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 AM | 1 Comment
